result.summary_1_page: The iPhone 15 Pro introduces a titanium frame, reducing weight by 19g while maintaining durability. All 9 sources highlight the A17 Pro chip's leading performance, with NotebookCheck noting sustained gaming capabilities despite some thermal throttling. The 48MP main camera receives universal acclaim, with DXOMark awarding 154 points, though low-light performance and ultrawide consistency are noted weaknesses. Battery life shows modest improvements (GSMArena 86h endurance), but 20W charging remains a consistent criticism. USB-C adoption is welcomed but limited to USB 2 speeds on the base model. iOS 17 brings new features like the Action Button, with Apple confirming 7 years of software support.
pros: Titanium frame reduces weight significantly (GSMArena, TechRadar, PhoneArena)
A17 Pro delivers exceptional performance and gaming capabilities (NotebookCheck, Tom's Guide, DXOMark)
48MP main camera with excellent dynamic range and Portrait mode (DXOMark score 154, praised by 8 sources)
USB-C finally adopted (universal praise across reviews)
7 years of software support (Apple confirmation cited by all)
cons: 20W charging remains slow vs competition (criticized by all 9 sources)
USB 2 speeds on base model is disappointing (Android Authority, The Verge)
Price increase in most markets (5 sources mention)
Thermal throttling under heavy load (NotebookCheck, Android Authority)
Limited 3x zoom vs Pro Max's 5x (PhoneArena, TechRadar)

attributes.name: Camera
attributes.explanation: DXOMark 154 (top 10 globally). Main sensor praised for 24MP default mode and dynamic range. Minor low-light weakness and ultrawide inconsistency noted by 3 sources.

attributes.name: Battery Endurance
attributes.explanation: GSMArena measured 86h endurance rating. Active use ~14.5h. 20W charging criticized universally. Efficient A17 Pro helps longevity.

attributes.name: Performance
attributes.explanation: A17 Pro leads benchmarks: Geekbench ~7200 multi-core, Antutu ~1.53M. Thermal throttling observed in stress tests but still class-leading.

attributes.name: Display
attributes.explanation: 6.1" Super Retina XDR OLED, 120Hz ProMotion, 2000 nits peak. GSMArena measured 1786 nits. Excellent color accuracy and outdoor visibility.

attributes.name: Software Experience
attributes.explanation: iOS 17 praised for Action Button customization and stability. 7 years of updates confirmed. Minor bugs in initial release noted by 2 sources.

attributes.name: Design & Build
attributes.explanation: Titanium build praised for reduced weight (187g) and premium feel. IP68 rating maintained. Action button well-received.

attributes.name: Longevity Value
attributes.explanation: 7-year support class-leading. High resale value historically. Price increase slightly hurts value proposition.
